Data Types

Variables can either be weakly typed or strongly typed. 

// weak typing
a = 0

// strong typing
i8 a = 0

There are several primitive data types that Blam offers. 

i8  - 8 bit integer
i16 - 16 bit integer
i32 - 32 bit integer
i64 - 32 bit integer

u8  - 8 bit unsigned integer
u16 - 16 bit unsigned integer
u32 - 32 bit unsigned integer
u64 - 64 bit unsigned integer

bool - boolean

char - character

Arrays should always be strongly typed. 

i16 array[3]
i16 array[] = [1, 2, 3]

Collections can be weakly typed and contain any data type. 

collection = [1, true]

Vector arrays and vector collections do not have a static size. 

i8 array = <1, 2, 3>
collection = <1, true>

Blam supports union and intersection types. 

int | str union
int & str intersection

Blam supports one type of dynamic string type 

str a = "this is a string"
